node.title: What's driving 'phenomenal' demand for Gold Coast properties?
node.description: They're called 'VESPAs' — Virus Escapees Seeking Provincial Australia — and they are helping to make rental affordability in the Gold Coast "one of the worst" in the country.
node.content:
["A major property marketing firm says more high-density developments on the central Gold Coast can be expected in 2022 with \"phenomenal\" housing\u00a0demand set to continue.", "It comes as the Rental Affordability Index\u00a0 \u2014 conducted in part by SGS Economics & Planning \u2014\u00a0lists Robina, Broadbeach and Helensvale as \"severely unaffordable\".", "SGS Partner Ellen White said that's when 30 to 40\u00a0per cent of household income is spent on rent.", "\"People on income support, that's often over 50 per cent,\"\u00a0Ms Witte said.", "\"Rental affordability has decreased by 11 per cent in the Gold Coast area and that's actually one of the worst scoring areas in the country.\"", "
'We've never seen this before'
", "Director of Colliers Residential David Higgins\u00a0said more people aged 25-to-40 had been moving\u00a0to the Gold Coast than the traditional 45-plus age group.", "", "
The Gold Coast has seen a jump in interstate migration during the pandemic.(Source: Dominic Cansdale)
", "\"They're called VESPAs \u2014 Virus Escapees Seeking Provincial Australia \u2014 all these young millennials,\" he said.", "Mr Higgins said the \"phenomenal\" growth has been the highest he's seen in 30 years, with strong interest from\u00a0interstate buyers.", "\"We will see more activity coming out of the southern market because they can actually come up here and visit,\" he said.", "\"I think it's going to be January, February, March when we're going to see a swell of all new inquiry.\"", "", "
More high-rises will be seen on the central Gold Coast amid high buyer demand.(ABC Gold Coast: Dominic Cansdale)
", "While the past 18 months has seen more high-cost medium-rise boutique developments hit the market, Mr Higgins said demand has created the need for\u00a0more high-density infill developments.", "\"Maybe there'll be a steadying on the price growth, so it doesn't continue to accelerate and price people out of the market,\" he said.", "
Mixed results for landlords and tenants
", "Colliers has been marketing the sale of 400 units at a high-rise development in Broadbeach with entry level prices at $650,000.", "David Higgins said such supply is needed if price growth is to stabilise.", "\"The landlords are doing really well but it's very tough on tenants,\" he said.", "Mayor Tom Tate said there are\u00a0\"two sides to the coin\" but council has sought to meet demand through the approval of high-rise developments and the $1.5 billion Skyridge housing estate.", "\"The Gold Coast is getting very popular,\" he said.", "\"Somebody who's well-educated, tradesmen, double income with no kids \u2014 they're struggling.\""]
